meanings.definition: To assign a new number to something.
meanings.sent1: I will renumber the pages in my notebook to organize them better.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to renumber the books after they were rearranged.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally renumbered the seats at the party, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: She decided to renumber her priorities after the life-changing event.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to renumber the paragraphs in their essays for clarity.

meanings.definition: To change the numbering of something.
meanings.sent1: The museum had to renumber the exhibits for the new display.
meanings.sent2: It took hours to renumber the files in the correct order.
meanings.sent3: The prankster tried to renumber the street signs for a joke.
meanings.sent4: The storm was so strong that it seemed to renumber the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The software update caused the system to renumber the data automatically.
